result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/31/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with codefendant/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:37 PM Defendant John R Williams in court, in custody. Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for John R Williams. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
